alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Franklin; Huntingdon; Juniata; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 6:26PM EDT until July 23 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Cumberland County in south central Pennsylvania... Northeastern Franklin County in south central Pennsylvania... Southeastern Huntingdon County in central Pennsylvania... Southwestern Juniata County in central Pennsylvania... Southwestern Perry County in south central Pennsylvania... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 625 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Big Spring State Park, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Newville, Honey Grove, Spruce Hill, Rockhill Furnace, East Waterford, Bloserville, Roxbury, Perulack, Big Spring State Park, Doylesburg, Colonel Denning State Park and Willow Hill. This includes the following Interstates... The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 185 to 216. Interstate 81 from mile markers 36 to 38. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
